paperTitle: A Multi-Chamber Smart Suction Cup for Adaptive Gripping and Haptic Exploration

candidates.title: Tactile sensing based on fingertip suction flow for submerged dexterous manipulation
candidates.reason: Direct conceptual precursor showing that suction flow/pressure encodes contact geometry for haptics; P generalizes this idea to a multi-chamber suction cup for exploration and seal-break sensing.

candidates.title: Long Short-Term Memory
candidates.reason: Core learning method used in P to localize seal-break quadrants and detect failure early; central to P’s main results and shown to outperform alternatives.

candidates.title: Bellows Suction Cup Equipped With Force Sensing Ability by Direct Coating Thin-Film Resistor for Vacuum Type Robotic Hand
candidates.reason: Prior art on instrumented suction cups; motivates embedding sensing in suction tools even though modality differs (force vs vacuum/flow).

candidates.title: Dex-Net 3.0: Computing Robust Robot Suction Grasp Targets in Point Clouds using a New Analytic Model and Deep Learning
candidates.reason: Influential baseline for suction grasp target selection and seal formation; P positions haptic exploration as complementary for selecting robust suction sites.

candidates.title: Extracting object properties through haptic exploration.
candidates.reason: Informs P’s gentle sliding/palpation regime; supports the idea that exploratory procedures can reveal surface transitions and guide grasp selection.

candidates.title: Lessons from the Amazon Picking Challenge: Four Aspects of Building Robotic Systems
candidates.reason: Establishes simple vacuum-pressure monitoring as a discrete seal indicator; P advances this to multi-chamber, differential sensing and early failure detection.

candidates.title: XGBoost: A Scalable Tree Boosting System
candidates.reason: Implemented as a primary baseline in P with reported settings and metrics; helps substantiate P’s claim that LSTM is superior for this task.

candidates.title: Good features to track
candidates.reason: Provides the KLT/min-eigenvalue feature tracking used in P’s experiments to track contact/centers; methodological support.

paperTitle: A Multi-Chamber Smart Suction Cup for Adaptive Gripping and Haptic Exploration

candidates.title: Planning Grasps With Suction Cups and Parallel Grippers Using Superimposed Segmentation of Object Meshes
candidates.reason: Background on suction grasp planning from object meshes; contextualizes P’s sensing-driven approach to selecting suction locations.

candidates.title: Critically fast pick-and-place with suction cups
candidates.reason: Related to suction-contact stability during fast motions; tangential motivation for detecting impending seal failures.

candidates.title: Manipulation with Suction Cups Using External Contacts
candidates.reason: Demonstrates advanced manipulation with suction and external contacts; relevant to suction manipulation but not central to P’s sensing contributions.

candidates.title: Analysis and Observations From the First Amazon Picking Challenge
candidates.reason: General motivation highlighting suction’s advantages across item types; contextual background.

candidates.title: Robotic pick-and-place of novel objects in clutter with multi-affordance grasping and cross-domain image matching
candidates.reason: Background on learned grasp affordances; peripheral to P’s sensing-centric method.

candidates.title: Cartman: The Low-Cost Cartesian Manipulator that Won the Amazon Robotics Challenge
candidates.reason: System-level reference used as context for planning approaches; minimal direct influence on P’s sensing or haptic exploration.
